original: Berg, Otto Herbert, lantmätare, Oskarshamn, f. 6/10/02 i Roslagsbro, Sthlms 1., av Gustaf Oskar B. o. Charlotta Fröier. G. 35 m. Eva Strömberg. Barn: Lennart f. 36, Harald 41. — Stud:ex. 22, fil. kand. 27, lantmätiex. 30, kulturtekn. kurs v. KTH 33. Stud:-res. t. Finl. 33, Tyskl. o. Ital. 35, Litauen, Letti. o. Estl. 38. Delt. i rikets allm. kartverks astronom, o. geodet. fältarb. 25-26, e. lantmät. i Gävleb. 1. 30-32, i Älvsb. 1. 33, Skarab. 1. 34-35, aman. o. tf. byråing. i lantmät :styr. 36-40, tf. distr :lantmät. i Oskarshamn sed. 40. Skr.: art. i Sv. Lantmäteri-tidskr. o. tidn .’pressen. Hobby: bebyggelsehistoria.
translated: Berg, Otto Herbert, land surveyor, from Oskarshamn, born on October 6th, 1902 in Roslagsbro, Stockholm county. Son of Gustaf Oskar B. and Charlotta Fröier. Married in 1935 to Eva Strömberg. Children: Lennart, born in 1936 and Harald, born in 1941. He took his high school exam in 1922, graduated with a bachelor's degree in philosophy in 1927, and passed his land surveyor exam in 1930. He attended a cultural technology course at KTH in 1933. He took study trips to Finland in 1933, Germany and Italy in 1935, and Lithuania, Latvia, and Estonia in 1938. From 1925 to 1926, he participated in general cartographic astronomical and geodetic fieldwork for the state. He was a land surveyor in Gävleb. 1 from 1930 to 1932, in Älvsb. 1 in 1933, and in Skarab. 1 from 1934 to 1935. He was an assistant and temporary bureau engineer in the land surveyor authority from 1936 to 1940, and temporary district land surveyor in Oskarshamn since 1940. He has written articles in Swedish Land Surveying Magazine and the newspaper pressen. His hobby is historical settlement studies.
